bug.short_desc: Check parser for consistency regarding ECMAScript support

long_desc.thetext:
When using a reserved word such as 'continue' as a member name in application code, the parser dies with an error:
Expected identifier but found reserved/CONTINUE: 'continue'
This is expected behavior for ECMAScript 3 but ECMAScript 5 allows using reserved words as member names. We should check the parser's consistency in applying ECMAScript 3 rules and evaluate how to deal with ECMAScript 5 code, if at all.

Anyone looked into this? I'm trying to use the IndexedDB API in my application and one of the specified methods in that API is named "continue". Thus the issue is not simply one of "Do we want to support ECMAScript 5 use of reserved words for identifiers?" but "Do we want to support HTML5 programming?"
No, we didn't take a look at that yet. But the point you mentioned is a good one. If there is already code out there, we should take care of that. I moved up the priority.
